channel.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server
channel.description:
"Unrecognized option: -d Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine. Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . ."
I've tried multiple sources and clients, as well as some other things but I absolutely am stumped. Can anyone help?
Batch: @echo off title Compiler color 5d :build cls "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d Data\CompiledFiles source\server\model\items\*.java source\server\model\minigames\*.java source\server\model\npcs\*.java source\server\model\objects\*.java source\server\model\players\*.java source\server\model\players\skills\*.java source\server\model\players\packets\*.java source\server\model\shops\*.java source\server\net\*.java source\server\task\*.java source\server\util\*.java source\server\world\*.java source\server\util\log\*.java source\server\*.java source\server\clip\*.java source\server\world\map\*.java source\server\clip\region\*.java source\server\model\players\Content\*.java pause goto :build

item.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:8, topic:529088”][quote author=EpicTylar link=topic=647841.msg4357337#msg4357337 date=1377963734]
I’m running via Eclipse now; only problem is it runs insanely slow; any advice?
[/quote]
If Eclipse is running slow, it’s probably time for a new computer. Of course, that’s not always an option for everyone, so if you can’t get/build a new one I suppose you may have to deal with it for now[/quote]Or learn the old fashioned way. There’s definitely some lower level IDE’s available though.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

EpicTylar:

I’m running via Eclipse now; only problem is it runs insanely slow; any advice?

If Eclipse is running slow, it’s probably time for a new computer. Of course, that’s not always an option for everyone, so if you can’t get/build a new one I suppose you may have to deal with it for now

item.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server
item.dc:creator: @EpicTylar EpicTylar
item.description:
@EpicTylar wrote:

Null Amount:

Add in -xmx 1024M before -classpath (or after, doesn’t matter) to increase the maximum amount of memory that the JVM is allowed to use (in this case, it can use a maximum of 1024MB of memory).

I’ve managed to get that out of the way; but this has arose:
“javac: invalid flag: -Dfile.encoding=Cp1252
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .”

Read full topic

item.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server

item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Add in -xmx 1024M before -classpath (or after, doesn’t matter) to increase the maximum amount of memory that the JVM is allowed to use (in this case, it can use a maximum of 1024MB of memory).

item.title: Can't compile any rsps/private server
item.dc:creator: @EpicTylar EpicTylar
item.description:
@EpicTylar wrote:

“Unrecognized option: -d
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .”

I’ve tried multiple sources and clients, as well as some other things but I absolutely am stumped. Can anyone help?

Batch:
@echo off
title Compiler
color 5d
:build
cls
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d Data\CompiledFiles source\server\model\items*.java source\server\model\minigames*.java source\server\model\npcs*.java source\server\model\objects*.java source\server\model\players*.java source\server\model\players\skills*.java source\server\model\players\packets*.java source\server\model\shops*.java source\server\net*.java source\server\task*.java source\server\util*.java source\server\world*.java source\server\util\log*.java source\server*.java source\server\clip*.java source\server\world\map*.java source\server\clip\region*.java source\server\model\players\Content*.java
pause
goto :build
